description: Subject-Verb-Object word order.

description: Der, die, das, ein, eine, and their usage.

description: Understanding and using the Nominative and Accusative cases.

description: Common prepositions governing the accusative case (e.g., für, mit, durch).

description: Mein, dein, sein, ihr, unser, euer, Ihr - possessive pronouns and their declension.

title: Modal Verbs (können, müssen, wollen)
description: Basic usage of modal verbs with infinitive constructions.

description: Wer, was, wo, wann, wie, warum - forming basic questions.

description: Basic adjective endings with definite articles.

title: Numbers and Counting
description: Numbers 1-100 and their usage in simple contexts.

description: Common phrases for greetings, introductions, and farewells.

title: Word Order in Simple Sentences
description: Subject-Verb-Object and time/manner adverbials.

description: Regular and irregular verbs in the present tense; modal verbs.

description: Formation and use of Präteritum (weak & strong verbs) and Perfekt.

title: Personal Pronouns
description: Nominative, accusative, dative, and genitive personal pronouns.

title: Possessive Pronouns
description: Possessive pronouns and their declension.

title: Definite and Indefinite Articles
description: Correct use of der, die, das, ein, eine, and kein(e).

title: Accusative Case
description: Understanding and using the accusative case with verbs and prepositions.

description: Understanding and using the dative case with verbs and prepositions.

description: Common prepositions governing accusative and dative cases.

title: Adjective Declension (Basic)
description: Weak and mixed declension after definite and indefinite articles.

title: Word Order in Main Clauses
description: Standard word order (subject-verb-object) and position of time/manner adverbs.

title: Simple Sentence Structure
description: Building simple sentences with conjunctions (und, oder, aber).

title: Modal Verbs (können, müssen, sollen, dürfen, wollen, mögen)
description: Usage and meaning of common modal verbs.

title: Time Expressions
description: Vocabulary related to days, months, seasons, and telling time.

title: Past Tenses (Präteritum & Perfekt)
description: Formation and usage of Präteritum and Perfekt to describe past events.

title: Modal Verbs
description: Usage and conjugation of common modal verbs (können, müssen, sollen, dürfen, wollen, mögen).

title: Subjunctive II (Konjunktiv II)
description: Formation and use for polite requests, hypothetical situations, and indirect speech.

title: Relative Clauses
description: Forming and using relative clauses with relative pronouns (der, die, das, welcher, welche, welches).

title: Passive Voice
description: Formation and use of the passive voice (werden + past participle).

title: Adjective Declension (with and without definite article)
description: Correct declension of adjectives based on gender, number, and case.

title: Prepositions with Accusative, Dative, and Genitive
description: Understanding and using prepositions with the correct case.

description: Reinforcement of case usage in various sentence structures.

title: Pronouns (Possessive, Demonstrative, Relative)
description: Correct usage of different types of pronouns.

title: Word Order in Main and Subordinate Clauses
description: Understanding and applying correct word order, including verb placement.

title: Articles (Definite, Indefinite, Zero Article)
description: Correct use of articles with nouns.

title: Conjunctions (and, but, or, because, that)
description: Using conjunctions to connect clauses and express relationships.

title: Indirect Speech (reported speech)
description: Reporting what someone else said using Konjunktiv II and appropriate conjunctions.

title: Subjunctive II & III
description: Formation and use of Konjunktiv II and III for hypothetical situations, indirect speech, and polite requests.

title: Passive Voice
description: Formation and use of the passive voice in various tenses.

title: Relative Clauses
description: Complex sentence structures using relative pronouns and clauses.

title: Noun Clauses
description: Using noun clauses with 'dass', 'ob', and 'wie'.

title: Prepositions with Accusative, Dative, and Genitive
description: Advanced usage and nuances of German prepositions and case selection.

title: Adjective Declension (Mixed and Strong)
description: Complete mastery of adjective declension after definite, indefinite, and no articles.

title: Pronoun Usage (Relative, Possessive, Demonstrative)
description: Advanced use of pronouns in complex sentences.

title: Word Order in Subordinate Clauses
description: Correct placement of verbs and other sentence elements in subordinate clauses.

title: Nominalization
description: Turning verbs into nouns and using them in sentences.

title: Cases (Dative after Verbs)
description: Advanced understanding of dative case usage with verbs.

title: Modal Particles
description: Understanding and using modal particles (e.g., doch, aber, dann) to express nuance.

title: Prefix Verbs (Trennbare & Untrennbare)
description: Advanced usage and understanding of separable and inseparable verbs.

title: German Cultural Nuances
description: Understanding cultural contexts affecting language use.

title: Subjunctive II & III
description: Mastery of Konjunktiv II for unreal conditions and polite requests; understanding and using Konjunktiv III.

title: Passive Voice (Advanced)
description: Nuanced use of passive constructions, including statal and dynamic passives.

title: Noun & Adjective Declension (Complex Cases)
description: Accurate declension in all cases, including mixed constructions and after prepositions.

title: Prepositions with Accusative, Dative, Genitive
description: Advanced understanding of preposition usage and case governance.

title: Relative Clauses (Advanced)
description: Complex relative clause constructions and relative pronouns.

title: Nominalization
description: Forming nouns from verbs and adjectives; using nominalized constructions effectively.

title: Partizipial Constructions
description: Using Partizip I and II as adjectival modifiers and in adverbial clauses.

title: Modal Particles
description: Understanding and correctly using modal particles (e.g., doch, eigentlich, ja) to convey nuance.

title: Indirect Speech (Advanced)
description: Reporting speech with complex tenses and subordinate clauses.

title: Complex Sentence Structures
description: Combining multiple clauses effectively for complex arguments and narratives.

title: Pronoun Variation
description: Mastery of all pronoun types (relative, demonstrative, possessive, etc.) and their correct usage.

title: Word Order in Complex Sentences
description: Applying correct word order rules in main and subordinate clauses, including inverted word order.

title: German-Specific Idioms & Fixed Expressions
description: Extensive knowledge of idioms and fixed expressions for natural and fluent communication.

title: Cultural Nuances in Language
description: Understanding how cultural context influences language use and interpretation.

title: Subjunctive II & III Mastery
description: Nuanced use of Konjunktiv II and III for hypothetical situations, indirect speech, and polite requests.

title: N-Genitive Revival & Complex Structures
description: Advanced use of the Genitive case, including its re-emergence in formal contexts and complex noun phrases.

title: Modal Particle Usage
description: Precise application of modal particles (e.g., doch, eben, ja) to convey subtle meanings and speaker attitude.

title: Complex Sentence Structures
description: Mastery of advanced relative, causal, conditional, and concessive clauses, including nested structures.

title: Passive Voice Variations
description: Understanding and using all forms of the passive voice, including the 'werden' and 'sein' passives, and the impersonal passive.

title: Nominalization & Substantivierung
description: Converting verbs, adjectives, and adverbs into nouns and using them effectively in complex sentences.

title: Prepositional Phrases & Idioms
description: Advanced use of prepositions with specific verbs and nouns, including idiomatic expressions.

title: Reflexive Verbs & Pronouns
description: Nuances of reflexive verbs, including reciprocal and passive reflexive constructions.

title: Adjective Declension (All Cases)
description: Complete mastery of adjective declension in all cases, including mixed declensions and attributive/predicative adjectives.

title: Word Order Variations
description: Understanding and applying flexible word order for emphasis, stylistic effect, and complex sentence structures.

title: Articles with Abstract Nouns
description: Correct use of articles with general and abstract nouns in complex contexts.

title: Formal vs. Informal Language
description: Distinguishing between formal and informal registers and adapting language accordingly.

title: Technical & Specialized Vocabulary
description: Expanding vocabulary in specific fields (e.g., law, science, economics).
